general.unknownFail: An error occured! Please press Ctrl+Shift+i and switch to 'Console' tab at the top, take a screenshot and create an Issue in GitHub, thanks for your understanding!
general.friendshipLinkMsg: Check out other awesome ACC related projects! If you have any ACC related projects, feel free to contact me to add a link!
general.contactMsg: If you encounter any issues while using Competizione Companion, or have any suggestions or ideas, feel free to contact me through the following methods:
general.hipoleIdMsg: You can find me by searching this ID in HiPole ACC 1/2 groups, AC 1 group, CHN24, HEC, AC EVO, AC Rally, LMU groups

servers.hipoleServerDownMsg: Lobby servers are down! Here is a list of common HiPole servers

help.1_1: Make sure ACC Connector is installed and ACC is closed.
help.2_1: Open ACC Connector and click the 'Settings' button at the bottom right.
help.2_2: Enter your ACC installation directory in 'ActualPath'.
help.2_3: You can open the installation directory as shown above, then click the address bar at the top of the Explorer window and copy it.
help.2_4: Paste the full address, then click 'Save'.
help.2_5: If you have already configured this before, you can skip this step.
help.3_1: With ACC not running, select a server in Competizione Companion and click '>>'.
help.3_2: ACC Connector will be automatically launched and configured.
help.3_3: Select the server you just chose, click 'Install hook' at the bottom right, and launch ACC.
help.4_2: If the Lobby servers are down, wait for 'FETCHING SERVER LIST' to time out (about 30 seconds) before proceeding.
help.4_3: When 'LAN SERVERS' becomes available, click it to see the server you selected.
help.4_4: Join the server as usual. Good luck & have fun!
help.5_2: If you will not race on this server again, click 'Remove' on the right to remove it.
help.5_3: Click 'Remove hook' at the bottom right and exit ACC Connector.

setup.dragFile: or drag and drop a file here
setup.emptyFileName: Please enter or select a setup file.
setup.invalidJSON: Invalid JSON format, please check the file content.
setup.invalidFile: Failed to read file, please drag a JSON-formatted ACC setup file.
setup.inputPlaceholder: Enter or select a setup file...
setup.setupNamePlaceholder: Enter a name for the setup
setup.codeCopyMsg: Open the 「Competizione Companion」 app, turn to Setup Management page and paste this message to load and save the setup in one click.
setup.generalTip1: First adjust the tire pressures, electronics, and other parameters with fixed windows to an appropriate level.
setup.generalTip2: Second, adjust the mechanical settings to balance personal driving preferences and pace.
setup.generalTip3: Third, adjust the aerodynamics as needed, balancing grip and top speed.
setup.generalTip4: Finally, fine-tune settings like damping that generally have small adjustment ranges.
setup.generalTip5: For detailed setup guidance, please refer to:

tyreCompound.name: Compound
tyreCompound.sum: Divided into WET and DRY tyres. It is recommended to use WET tyres when track conditions are FLOODED, WET, or DAMP; use dry tyres when GREASY, GREEN, FAST, or OPTIMUM.

tyrePressure.name: Pressure
tyrePressure.inc: Provides more lateral support, quicker initial response, increased steering precision, and suppresses tyre temperature rise; but reduces tyre contact patch, making it easier to overload and slide.
tyrePressure.dec: Allows the tyre to deform more, increasing the contact patch and grip limit, and tyre temperature rises faster; but reduces steering precision and initial response, and makes dynamics less linear.
tyrePressure.notes: Generally, dry tyres should stabilize at 26.7-27.2psi after warming up, and 27.1-27.3psi in high temperatures; wet tyres should stabilize at 29.5-31.0psi.

camber.name: Camber
camber.sum: Adjusts the angle between the tyre and the ground in the vertical direction; top inward is negative camber.
camber.inc: Reducing negative camber increases the contact patch when driving straight, improving braking efficiency and traction; but may reduce cornering grip and tyre heating efficiency, and cause the tyre's outer edge to overheat.
camber.dec: Increasing negative camber increases the contact patch during cornering, improving lateral grip and heating efficiency; but reduces braking efficiency and straight-line traction, and may cause the tyre's inner edge to overheat.
camber.notes: Generally, the temperature difference between the inner and outer tyre should be about 15 degrees, but in ACC it's usually set to the minimum.

toe.name: Toe
toe.sum: Looking from above, toe-out is negative, toe-in is positive.
toe.inc: Increasing front toe makes the outer tyre steer more than the inner, improving front-end response; but reduces mid-corner grip and can cause understeer.
toe.dec: Decreasing front toe makes the inner tyre steer more than the outer, improving initial steering response and weight transfer reaction, but reduces initial response and sensitivity.
toe.notes: Generally, slight changes in rear toe based on existing setups are OK.

caster.name: Caster
caster.sum: From the side, the angle between the steering axis and the horizontal plane is the caster angle.
caster.inc: Increases steering load on the front wheels, improves steering and self-centering response, but makes the steering wheel heavier; may slightly reduce braking response and steering consistency.
caster.dec: Reduces steering load on the front wheels, making overall response more linear and the steering wheel lighter; but reduces the upper limit of front-end steering response.
caster.notes: ACC tyres are very elastic, so you can maximize front-end steering ability with minimal side effects. Just max it out.

steerRatio.name: Steer Ratio
steerRatio.sum: The angle the steering wheel turns for each degree the wheels turn.
steerRatio.inc: Requires turning the wheel more to make a corner.
steerRatio.notes: Purely personal preference, set to what feels comfortable.

fuel.name: Fuel
fuel.sum: Adjusts how much fuel to start with.
fuel.inc: More fuel allows for more laps, but makes the car heavier, affecting balance and lap times.
fuel.dec: Less fuel reduces weight, but be careful not to run out.
fuel.notes: For qualifying, bring enough for 3-4 laps; after pushing, the tyres will be worn. For races, bring the calculated amount plus 2 laps. For N24 qualifying, bring only one lap of Nordschleife plus 1-2 laps of the full circuit.

brakePadCompound.name: Brake Pad Compound
brakePadCompound.sum: Adjusts the type number of the front brake pads.
brakePadCompound.notes: Use compound 1 for sprints under 90 minutes; compound 2 for endurance over 90 minutes; compound 3 for endurance with large temperature differences. Some cars can use compound 4 for qualifying, but it's rarely used as it wears out very quickly and performs similarly to compound 1.

tC1.name: TC1
tC1.sum: Adjusts the intervention threshold of the traction control system, i.e., how much slip before it activates.
tC1.inc: Reduces wheel slip under acceleration, making dynamics more stable; but limits corner exit power.
tC1.dec: Allows more slip under acceleration, helping to establish rotation; but may cause loss of control. For low-speed corners, consider upshifting early.
tC1.notes: Do NOT turn off electric assists in most cases, a proper amount makes you faster! Recommended: Ferrari 296 GT3 at 4-7, Ford Mustang GT3 at 4-6, BMW M4 GT3 at 2-3, AMR V8 GT3/AMG GT3 at 1-3, others at 1-2.

tC2.name: TC2
tC2.sum: Adjusts the strength of traction control intervention, i.e., how much power is cut when TC is triggered.
tC2.inc: Reduces wheel slip under acceleration, making dynamics more stable; but limits corner exit power.
tC2.dec: Allows more slip under acceleration, helping to establish rotation; but may cause loss of control. For low-speed corners, consider upshifting early.
tC2.notes: Generally recommended to keep off, or increase as needed.

abs.name: ABS
abs.sum: Adjusts the intervention threshold of the anti-lock braking system.
abs.inc: Reduces the chance of wheel lockup; but too high reduces braking efficiency.
abs.dec: Improves braking efficiency to some extent; but too low makes the brakes overly sensitive.
abs.notes: Do NOT turn off electric assists in most cases, a proper amount makes you faster! Generally, Ferrari 296 GT3: 1-2 in dry, others 2-3; 1-2 in wet.

eCUMap.name: ECU Map
eCUMap.sum: Adjusts the car's power output and fuel consumption presets.
eCUMap.notes: Different cars have different maps. Just copy a finished setup for your car.

telemetryLaps.name: Telemetry Laps
telemetryLaps.sum: Adjusts how many laps of telemetry data are automatically saved for analysis in MoTeC.
telemetryLaps.inc: Stores more laps, making it less likely to lose your best lap; but telemetry files will be larger and take up more space.
telemetryLaps.dec: Stores fewer laps, saving storage space.
telemetryLaps.notes: If you can't reach 102% of the world record lap time, it's recommended to turn this off. Understanding the track is more important than nitpicking details.

aRB.name: Anti-Roll Bar
aRB.sum: Adjusts the stiffness of the anti-roll bar.
aRB.inc: Stiffening the front ARB makes initial turn-in more responsive and improves stability on corner exit; but reduces elasticity and can cause mid-corner understeer. Stiffening the rear ARB makes the rear more responsive and increases lateral grip mid-corner; but reduces traction, makes rotation less linear, and can cause extreme slides when overloaded.
aRB.dec: Softening the front ARB increases mid-corner elasticity and reduces understeer; but weakens initial response and can cause instability on corner exit. Softening the rear ARB makes the rear more linear and improves traction; but increases pendulum effect and reduces lateral grip.

wheelRate.name: Wheel Rate
wheelRate.sum: Adjusts the force required to fully compress the suspension springs.
wheelRate.inc: Stiffening the springs increases front-end support, making responses quicker and more linear; but reduces overall grip and limits pitch.
wheelRate.dec: Softening the springs increases overall grip and allows more weight transfer; but weakens body response and can cause instability in corners due to insufficient support.
wheelRate.notes: Different cars have different ideal spring rates due to design. Generally, lower rates have higher theoretical limits, but fine-tune as needed based on finished setups.

bumpStopRateUp.name: Bump Stop
bumpStopRateUp.sum: Adjusts the stiffness of the bump stops, affecting feedback when the springs bottom out.
bumpStopRateUp.inc: Increases consistency during suspension compression, making dynamics from turn-in to mid-corner more linear; but limits grip when compressed and makes it easier to lose traction.
bumpStopRateUp.dec: Increases pitch travel, improving grip response under compression; but increases dynamic drop from turn-in to mid-corner, reducing consistency and possibly causing bottoming out.

bumpStopWindow.name: Bump Stop Range
bumpStopWindow.sum: Adjusts the travel of the bump stops, affecting feedback when the springs bottom out.
bumpStopWindow.inc: Increases overall pitch travel and grip limit, and improves response under compression; but also increases inertia and tyre load, which can reduce dynamic consistency.
bumpStopWindow.dec: Reduces pitch travel, effectively suppressing body inertia and tyre load to improve consistency; but reduces the range for weight transfer and grip limit.

brakeTorque.name: Brake Torque
brakeTorque.notes: ACC has magic ABS with very high efficiency, so just max it out. For cars with less effective ABS, reduce as needed.

brakeBias.name: Brake Bias
brakeBias.sum: Adjusts the distribution of braking force between front and rear wheels; the value represents the front.
brakeBias.inc: More braking force to the front wheels, improving stability on turn-in; but increases risk of front overload and understeer.
brakeBias.dec: More braking force to the rear wheels, making dynamics more aggressive on turn-in; but increases risk of rear overload and oversteer.
brakeBias.notes: Generally, lower bias for dry conditions, but adjust to suit setup and driving style; for wet, lower bias to avoid front lockup and improve rotation.

bumpSlow.name: Bump
bumpSlow.sum: Adjusts the compression rate of the springs during weight transfer under acceleration and braking.
bumpSlow.inc: Helps reduce body dive, reduces added response during pedal operation, and increases consistency; but also reduces pitch limit.
bumpSlow.dec: Helps increase body dive, amplifies response during pedal operation; but increases body dynamic changes and reduces consistency.
bumpSlow.notes: Current ACC meta: base damper settings are usually lowest for bumps, highest for rebounds.

bumpFast.name: Fast Bump
bumpFast.sum: Adjusts the compression rate of the springs when encountering small bumps or kerbs.
bumpFast.inc: Suppresses initial body dive, increases body support, and can slightly reduce bouncing from bumps; but reduces grip limit and makes overloading easier.
bumpFast.dec: Increases initial body dive, raises overall pitch limit; but makes the body more relaxed and increases inertia.
bumpFast.notes: Current ACC meta: base damper settings are usually lowest for bumps, highest for rebounds.

reboundSlow.name: Rebound
reboundSlow.sum: Adjusts the rebound rate of the springs during weight transfer under acceleration and braking.
reboundSlow.inc: Helps reduce body lift, reduces added response during pedal operation, and increases consistency; but also reduces pitch limit.
reboundSlow.dec: Helps increase body lift, amplifies response during pedal operation; but increases body dynamic changes and reduces consistency.
reboundSlow.notes: Current ACC meta: base damper settings are usually lowest for bumps, highest for rebounds.

reboundFast.name: Fast Rebound
reboundFast.sum: Adjusts the rebound rate of the springs after encountering small bumps or kerbs.
reboundFast.inc: Suppresses initial body lift, improves dynamic consistency, and increases body contact with the ground; but can cause the tyres to bounce if over-suppressed on bumpy surfaces.
reboundFast.dec: Increases initial body lift, weakens the dynamic binding between tyres and body, improving ground contact and slightly reducing bouncing from bumps; but makes the body more relaxed and increases inertia.
reboundFast.notes: Current ACC meta: base damper settings are usually lowest for bumps, highest for rebounds.

rideHeight.name: Ride Height
rideHeight.sum: Adjusts the height of the car's chassis.
rideHeight.inc: Less likely to scrape over bumps or kerbs; but raises the center of gravity, increases inertia, and reduces aerodynamic performance and overall grip.
rideHeight.dec: Reduces drag for better performance; but more likely to scrape over bumps or kerbs.

splitter.name: Splitter
splitter.sum: Adjusts the angle of the front splitter.
splitter.inc: Increases front downforce, providing more grip in corners; but affects acceleration and top speed.
splitter.dec: Reduces front downforce and available grip; but reduces drag, improving acceleration and top speed.
splitter.notes: Aero adjustments have different effects depending on the car. Unless necessary, keeping maximum downforce usually yields the best results.

wing.name: Rear Wing
wing.sum: Adjusts the angle of the rear wing.
wing.inc: Increases downforce, providing more grip and a wider grip window in corners; but affects acceleration and top speed. Suitable for tracks with many high-speed corners.
wing.dec: Reduces downforce and available grip, and narrows the optimal grip window at the rear; but reduces drag, improving acceleration and top speed. Suitable for tracks with many low-speed corners.
wing.notes: Aero adjustments have different effects depending on the car. Unless necessary, keeping maximum downforce usually yields the best results.

brakeDuct.name: Brake Duct
brakeDuct.sum: Adjusts the opening of the brake ducts.
brakeDuct.inc: Improves brake cooling; but may cause brakes and tyres to run too cool, and increases drag.
brakeDuct.dec: Reduces brake cooling and drag; but increases risk of overheating. Generally used for cold races or high-speed tracks.
brakeDuct.notes: If the brake discs are green after each corner and before heavy braking, and the tyres stay within the working temperature range, the setting is appropriate.

preload.name: Differential Preload
preload.sum: Adjusts the torque difference setting between the two sides of the axle.
preload.inc: Tighter rear axle, less dynamic change when lifting off, more pronounced rotation response at initial throttle, and improved consistency; but can overload the rear tyres.
preload.dec: Looser rear axle, more dynamic change when lifting off, weaker rotation response at initial throttle, and smoother dynamics; but can cause under-rotation on throttle, leading to understeer then snap oversteer on corner exit.

bop.saveToGUI: Save as preset or as bop.json
bop.dialogDesc2: Please restart ACC Dedicated Server GUI after saving to load the preset.
bop.overwriteNote1: If turned on, bop.json will be overwritten, please back up your data.
bop.overwriteNote2: If turned off, a new bop_1.json will be generated, you can rename it to apply the settings.

report.tip: Due to HiPole Online Reporting Rules, only Simplified Chinese is supported in this page.

settings.favCarsTracksTooltip: Favorite cars and tracks will be pinned to the top of all related lists
settings.alwaysViewOnly: Always Open Setups in View Only Mode
